description: Complete guide to using Photoshop brushes for creating realistic Fallout 4 textures, including weathering, dirt, and damage effects

items.title: ABR Brush Files - Installation Guide
items.content:
ABR (Adobe Brush) Files for Photoshop/Photopea

Installation:
1. Download .abr brush file
2. In Photoshop: Edit → Presets → Preset Manager → Load
3. In Photopea: www.photopea.com → Window → Brushes → Menu → Import Brushes
4. Select your .abr file
5. Brushes appear in Brush panel

Best Practices:
- Test on separate layer first
- Adjust opacity (10-30% for subtle effects)
- Use flow control for gradual application
- Combine multiple brushes for realism
- Save as Smart Object for non-destructive editing

items.title: Weathering Brushes - Rust and Corrosion
items.content:
Creating Rust Effects with Brushes:

1. Base Layer: Orange/brown rust color (#B7410E)
2. Brush Selection: Scattered/splatter brushes
3. Technique:
   - Large brush (200-400px) at 10% opacity
   - Random rotation enabled
   - Multiple passes for buildup
   - Vary brush size between passes

4. Advanced Weathering:
   - Layer 1: Light surface rust (orange)
   - Layer 2: Deep corrosion (dark brown)
   - Layer 3: Flaking metal (gray/white)
   - Use layer masks for control

5. Fallout 4 Specifics:
   - Rust collects at edges and seams
   - More rust near ground level
   - Apply to metal diffuse (_d) texture
   - Reduce in specular map for matte rust areas
